50:11 Caption: The resulting corner from Cristian Tello (FC Porto) only finds one of the defenders, who heads it out of danger.
50:32 Caption: The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
50:35 Caption: There was plenty of entertainment during the first 45 minutes. Hopefully more of the same in the second half. The first half was definitely edged by the home side. The home side attempts to hold onto the ball for as long as possible, while the away side focuses on defending and lets the opposition keep possession.

The home side attempted to hold onto the ball for as long as possible, while the away side focused on defending and let the opposition keep possession.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In an exhilarating encounter at EstÃ¡dio do DragÃ£o, FC Porto clashed with Basel in what turned out to be a spellbinding performance by the home side. FC Porto emerged triumphant with a commanding 4-0 victory over their Swiss opponents, Basel. Here is an intricate and detailed account of how the match unfolded.

### First Half

The match commenced with Basel kicking off, but it quickly became evident that this would be a tough contest for the Swiss outfit. Within the first minute, Basel's rough play resulted in a foul, leading to an indirect free kick for FC Porto. Porto started to display their intention early when Yacine Brahimi lined up for a free kick from the edge of the box. In a spectacular show of skill, Brahimi bent the ball over the Basel wall and into the net, leaving the goalkeeper flat-footed. Porto had managed to take a crucial early lead.

After this early goal, Basel struggled to find their rhythm. They committed numerous fouls, and their only moments of respite came from throw-ins and clearances. Vincent Aboubakar had a golden chance post the goal, but a poor first touch allowed the Basel defense to nullify the threat.

Basel's frustration began to show as the half wore on. Marco Streller was lucky to escape with just a warning for a slide tackle. His teammate, Walter Samuel, wasn't as fortunate and received a yellow card for his rough challenge. FC Porto continued to exploit these mishaps, pushing forward at every opportunity.

A turning point came for FC Porto when Danilo sustained an injury. Bruno Martins Indi replaced him, ensuring Portoâ€™s defensive line remained solid. Despite this change, FC Porto's attacking momentum remained unrelenting. Hector Herrera had a great chance from a long-range effort that was saved by Basel's goalkeeper, Tomas Vaclik.

The first half was marked by several off-target shots by FC Porto, with Casemiro and Vincent Aboubakar attempting to extend their lead but falling short. Basel managed to get a few shots off as well, particularly one memorable effort from Marco Streller which soared over the crossbar.

Basel tried to respond as the half wore on, but they found it difficult to break through Portoâ€™s disciplined defense. The half drew to a close with Basel unable to mount any significant threat to FC Porto's goal. FC Porto entered the break with a deserved lead, clearly the dominant side in the opening 45 minutes.

### Second Half

The beginning of the second half continued the pattern of FC Porto's dominance. They started with the same intensity and quickly won control of the ball. Within the first two minutes, FC Porto doubled their lead in spectacular fashion. Hector Herrera latched onto a well-placed pass from Yacine Brahimi and struck the ball with precision from the edge of the box, sending it into the bottom right corner of the net. The scoreline read 2-0 in favor of FC Porto.

Basel's attempts at recovery were feeble and marred by continual fouls. Walter Samuel once again found himself in the refereeâ€™s book, earning a yellow card for a harsh tackle right after the second goal. Basel seemed unable to keep their composure as FC Portoâ€™s meticulous passing and strategic play left them chasing shadows.

Furthermore, FC Porto continued to assert their dominance, obtaining another goal from an exceptional free-kick by Casemiro. Striking from 28 meters out, Casemiro sent the ball rocketing into the top left corner, evoking thunderous applause from the home fans.

The Swiss side decided to make some substitutions around the 12-minute mark in a bid to find some spark. Breel Embolo and Yoichiro Kakitani were introduced, hoping to change the tempo of the game. Still, it was a night of frustration for Basel as FC Porto remained in complete control. They constructed plays with precision and continued to exploit Basel's defensive frailties.

Vincent Aboubakar put the icing on FC Portoâ€™s cake with a brilliant individual effort, scoring from around 20 meters out, making it 4-0. Aboubakarâ€™s goal clinched a perfect evening for Porto, a night when everything seemed to click for them.

Despite trying to claw their way back, Basel's efforts were in vain. Marco Streller and Luca Zuffi had their chances, but Fabiano thwarted every attempt with superb saves. Basel's chances looked dimmer as they faced further challenges in breaking down a stubborn FC Porto defense.

The frustration translated into disciplinary issues for Basel. Walter Samuel received his marching orders after picking up his second yellow card of the night. Reduced to ten men, any slim hope of a Basel comeback vanished entirely.

In the final phases of the game, FC Porto continued to maintain a stranglehold over the possession and dictated the pace of the game. They executed several substitutions to run down the clock and solidify their already invincible position. Basel, on the other hand, saw their defensive strategies fall apart repeatedly as Portoâ€™s relentless attacks bore down on them.

The attendance of 43,108 spectators witnessed a masterclass in football from FC Porto, who demonstrably outplayed their opponents in every department. With a blend of clinical finishing, disciplined defending, and strategic astuteness, FC Porto exemplified why they are a formidable side in European competitions.

### Conclusion

In summary, FC Portoâ€™s 4-0 dismantling of Basel was a vivid testament to their prowess on the pitch. From start to finish, they exhibited superior quality both in individual talent and team coordination. Yacine Brahimi's early goal set the tone, and as the match progressed, Hector Herrera, Casemiro, and Vincent Aboubakar added their names to the scoresheet with splendid goals.

Baselâ€™s inability to adapt and penetrate FC Portoâ€™s solid defenses was glaring, and their frustrations culminating in fouls and cards only exacerbated their plight. FC Porto, on the other hand, showcased not just their attacking flair but also their defensive resilience, with Fabiano maintaining a clean sheet through several crucial saves.

Ultimately, FC Porto advances with confidence, having delivered an exemplary performance that highlights their credentials as one of Europeâ€™s elite. Basel will have much to reflect on as they faced a clear gulf in class during this match. It was a night where FC Porto reigned supreme, leaving their fans with memories of a near-perfect outing and a shining example of footballing excellence.
